snippet: Researchers say a newly discovered galaxy is emitting a surprising amount of gamma rays, which, if confirmed, may provide answers as to the mysterious dark matter that permeates the universe.
abstract: Study in journal Physical Review Letters reports discovery that small galaxy orbiting Milky Way is emitting large amount of electromagnetic radiation in form of gamma rays; results, if confirmed, could provide valuable information about dark matter thought to make up 80 percent of universe.
lead_paragraph: Researchers say a newly discovered galaxy is emitting a surprising amount of gamma rays, which, if confirmed, may provide answers as to the mysterious dark matter that permeates the universe.

headline.main: Gamma Rays May Be Clue on Dark Matter
headline.print_headline: Gamma Rays May Be Clue on Dark Matter
